As the dials of a speedometer blurs and the adrenaline surges,
As the corner gets tighter and the wheels start to skid,
As you thread the fine line between victory and a gory crash,
That's when you are on top of the world.
The cops?
Humbugs.

Need for Speed: Most Wanted (commonly known as NFS: MW) is a racing video game featuring street racing-oriented game play. Easily among the most popular racing games of all times, this instant classic has had players hooked ever since its release. Though many iterations have come out in the NFS series, NFS: MW remains an all-time favourite because of its competitive nature and gamers have been known to keep practicing to shave off those crucial milli-seconds off their lap times. Being a racing game, it's easy to pick up and play and the adrenaline rush of speeding along and overtaking into the pole position is known to all.

Registration:

1. Rs. 50/- per participant.
2. Tathva registration is compulsory.
3. Registration will be closed after prelims.

Qualification Round:

1. All Tournament participants will play 3 laps and the qualifier for further rounds will be decided by best time basis! (TOP 16).
2. Players can choose their cars, customize them and modify them.
3. Race course: Dunwich Bay.
4. At the end of each match, players must maintain the final screens and receive confirmation from a referee.
5. Any participant failing to complete the race will be disqualified.

Common Rules for Competitive rounds, Semi-finals and Finals:

1. Game Type: Circuit
2. No. of Laps: 3
3. Courses: Courses will be given at random and will be given on the spot. ( Players will be informed before the tournament of any such modifications)
4. Participants are not allowed to use their own profiles, only Immolation provided save files can be used for car setting.
5. Players will be given 2 minutes to setup the car and its performance before the game.

Competitive Rounds:

1. There will be two levels: level 1 (all 16 qualifiers), and level 2 (top 8 from level 1).
2. Courses: Heritage Heights, Diamond, Switchback, East Park, Omega, Dunwich Bay, Oil Refinery, Bay Bridge and Clubhouse.

3. Competition: All qualifying participants will compete in a 'Circuit' mode in groups of 4 on LAN.
4. LEVEL 1: The first two players to finish all 3 laps will qualify to the next round (level 2).
5. LEVEL 2: The player, who finishes first, will qualify for the semi-finals.

Semi-Finals:

1. Courses: Heritage Heights, Diamond, East Park, Dunwich Bay, Bay Bridge and oil refinery.
2. Competition: All 4 qualifying participants will compete together in 6 races in 'Circuit' mode on LAN.
3. Winning a race: The winner of a race is the first player to complete 3 laps of the circuit course and cross the finish line.
4. Qualifying: The 2 players winning at-least 2 races will be qualified for the finals.

Finals:

1. Courses: Heritage Heights, Diamond, East Park, Dunwich Bay and Bay Bridge.
2. Competition: All qualifying participants will compete 1 vs. 1 in 5 races in 'Circuit' mode on LAN.
3. Winning a race: The winner of a race is the first player to complete 3 laps of the circuit course and cross the finish line.
4. Winning the tournament: A player winning 3 races out of 5 will be the 'winner' of the tournament.
Other specifications:

1. Race Mode Options:
 a. Track Direction : Forward/Backward
 b. LAPS : 3
 c. N20 : On
 d. Collision Detection : Off
 e. Performance Matching : On
2. Use of any cheat program is not allowed. Use of Carrera GT and BMW GTR is not allowed. Use of Junkman upgrades is not allowed. Use of any settings exceeding standard and permitted settings is not allowed.
3. If the match is disrupted due to unnecessary chatting, the player may be given a warning or lose by default at the referee's sole discretion. Two warnings constitute being disqualified from the tournament.
4. Any disconnection of the connection between matches players due to System, Network, PC, and/or Power problems/issues results into a restart of match. If any player does not agree to a match restart, that player will lose by default.
5. Intentional disconnection will not be tolerated. Upon judgment by the referee, any offending player will be charged with a loss by forfeit.
